page.title: 01The Area West Of Widdrington
page.content: Lying in the coastal plain, the landscape is mostly flat then rises gently to a height of 300ft at its western edge. A rich agricultural area where the land cover is almost equally half arable and half grass, with a number of woodlands featuring prominently. Within this rural setting lies a section of the main east coast railway line, an open cast mining site and a brick works. The largest number of local people are employed on the eight farms covering the area, followed by the brick works and the open cast site, with British Rail employing only two locals at Felton Land level crossing and Chevington signal box. There are few houses the largest groups comprising farm workers cottages with a few farm houses and railway cottages. There are no public transport
